title: revert: network ID address changes

title: fix: make address networks global
body:
reverts the revert of #923 and #929, then replaces most of the logic (we'll squash before merging)

We relied on `new_id` being "const" in several places, so the previous patches weren't going to work. I had a few options:

1. Revert.

2. Make it a compile time option. This is strictly less flexible than the current option.

3. Use a third value for "default" or "unset" that simply follows the system default. This was probably a better solution than the existing one, but made the Eq implementation a bit tricky.

So, instead of all of these solutions, I took a closer look at the issue:

1. Any solution that bundles "networks" with addresses will have a bit of a race: any address constructed _before_ the network is set will be wrong.

2. Addresses don't really _have_ networks. _Textual_ addresses do, but addresses lose their networks as soon as they're parsed.

So I opted for a completely new option (that, honestly, more closely matches lotus's behavior):

1. Remove networks from addresses.
2. Enforce that addresses have the correct network _on parse_.
3. Use the "current" network _on format_.

In this world, implementations should set the correct network before trying to parse any addresses. However, if they get this wrong, they'll get an actual _error_ instead of getting addresses that _should_ be equivalent but aren't.

---

Breaking:

- Removes `network` from the `Address` type. I can't actually find any calls in forest or the builtin actors outside of tests.
- Removes `set_network` from the `Address` type. Again, this wasn't called outside of tests.
- Enforces that all textual addresses match the correct network on parse. This is the change most likely to cause issues, if any.

Alternatives to this last point would be to accept any valid "network" and ignore it (what lotus does). But I'd really rather not as this could be quite useful for catching bugs. Anyways, this is more likely to catch _bugs_ from addresses that hard-code a specific network than anything else.

title: fix: update set_default_network to use store api instead
body: atomic `store` API should be better than `fetch_update` here.

title: feat: simplify syscall returns
body:
Some history:

- At first, we returned an Option because these syscalls would return a special sentinel value for "not found".
- Then we changed the syscalls to return the NotFound error code, but we never updated the kernel methods.

Now, I'm adding another kernel method. But in my case, to keep this pattern, I'd need to return `Option<Option<Address>>`... so I'm proposing that we change these other kernel functions instead.

title: fix: compile wasm test actors separately
body:
Compile each test actor as _either_ a byte blob containing the wasm module, or as a wasm module.

Previously, we'd compile all test actors into the _test_ binary. But really, we only want them compiled into individual wasm binaries. This sort of worked for some reason, but really shouldn't have, as each wasm module exported a non-mangled "invoke" function.

Unfortunately, it looks like it stopped "sort of working" the second @mriise added a _second_ exported function.

title: sdk: add invocation context accessors for gas limit and premium
body: eaten during refactoring in #905.

title: feat: auto-load wasm modules from blockstore
body:
In general, wasm modules should already be cached. However, pre-loading during tests is expensive, so it's nice to allow lazy loading.

This is likely still useful in M2.2. Even though the module _should_ be pre-compiled, the module cache will still be a _cache_.

Also note: A "baseline" compiler is coming to wasmtime (https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/pull/4907) that will make lazy-loading a more viable option.

replaces #907 #714

title: EVM-899: Hamt::flush short circuit on no change
body:
fixes https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/pull/709

The PR adds an optional `flushed_cid` field to the `Hamt` which is used to remember the CID it was initialized with until something changes and the `Hamt` if flushed again. If the field is set during `flush`, we have nothing to do and can return the already calculated CID. 

This saves the effort of serializing the root node and passing the data through the Wasm machinery for the CID to be calculated when there was no change made to the contents of the map.

If this PR is acceptable, it would be worth doing the same for the `Amt` in another PR.

title: Format RawBytes debug as hex string rather than array of decimals
body:
The derived representation of a list of decimals is very unhelpful when debugging, e.g. CBOR-encoded values. The hex string will at least be usable in an CBOR inspector, and I think usually not less useful for cases when the bytes are representing something else (tho since this is the CBOR library, that'll be uncommon).

FYI @ZenGround0 when debugging actors.

title: feat: avoid importing the bundle into the integration tests
body:
This change:

- Moves the actor "bundle" dependency to the dev dependencies.
- Makes the `Tester` take a "bundle root cid".
- Exports a helper function for importing a bundle into a blockstore.

That way:

1. Users can instantiate integration tests with their _own_ bundle.
2. We can publish the integration testing _framework_ while testing against a dev bundle locally.

This caused problems on publish because the `fil_ipld_actor` is a dev dependency, and features can't apply to dev dependencies like that.

3. Implement `TokenAmount::from_nano` so we can construct from nanoFIL.
